name: scoop
description: CLI package manager for Windows. Installs all packages to a user-writeable path so backups are easy and admin privileges are not required.

name: chezmoi
description: Dotfile manager written in Go. Uses Go templates to render files per-machine. Backups & restores to a Git repository.

name: git
description: Git needs no introduction!

name: LazyGit
description: Terminal UI for interacting with Git repositories.

name: hoppscotch
description: Open-source, self-hostable API development ecosystem. An alternative to Postman

name: HTTPie
description: Open-source API development ecosystem. An alternative to Postman

name: direnv
description: Dotfile manager written in Go. Uses Go templates to render files per-machine. Backups & restores to a Git repository.

name: RClone
description: 'rsync for cloud storage.' RClone lets you connect to many backends, like S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, Google Drive, Wasabi, etc, and sync to/from it like you would with rsync.

name: cookiecutter
description: Dotfile manager written in Go. Uses Go templates to render files per-machine. Backups & restores to a Git repository.

name: vulture
description: Finds unused code in Python programs.

name: pipx
description: Install and run Python applications in isolated environments.

name: pyenv
description: Simple Python version management. Allows you to easily switch between multiple versions of Python. Can be used to manage multiple versions of Python on a per-project basis.

name: uv
description: A Python package & project manager written in Rust.

name: restic
description: Fast, secure, efficient backup program. Supports many backends, including local disk, SFTP, AWS S3, Backblaze B2, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Microsoft Azure Blob Storage, and more.

name: resticprofile
description: A wrapper around restic to manage multiple backup profiles with different configurations. Uses a `~/.profile.yaml` file to define backup jobs.

name: radon
description: A Python tool that computes various metrics from the source code. It can compute Cyclomatic Complexity, Halstead metrics, Maintainability Index, and raw metrics like lines of code.

name: xenon
description: A Python tool that checks code complexity against defined thresholds. It can check Cyclomatic Complexity, Maintainability Index, and raw metrics like lines of code.

name: devpod
description: Like Github codespaces, but open source, client-only, and unopinionated. Works with any IDE and lets you use any cloud, Kubernetes, or localhost Docker.

name: Ente Auth
description: Ente Auth is an open-source identity and access management solution that provides secure authentication and authorization for applications and services.

name: Fail2Ban
description: Intrusion prevention software framework that protects computer servers from brute-force attacks.

name: Pre-commit
description: A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit hooks.

name: Dagger
description: Dagger is a programmable CI/CD engine that lets you define and run pipelines as code using a unified API across any language, framework, or cloud.

name: Aqua
description: Aqua is a CLI tool that manages your developer tools and ensures consistent versions across your projects. It supports multiple languages and package managers.

name: Starship
description: The minimal, blazing-fast, and infinitely customizable prompt for any shell.

name: Wezterm
description: A GPU-accelerated cross-platform terminal emulator and multiplexer written by @wez and implemented in Rust.

name: neovim
description: Neovim is a hyperextensible Vim-based text editor. It seeks to improve upon Vim by providing better defaults, a more modern codebase, and a robust plugin architecture.

name: tmux
description: tmux is a terminal multiplexer. It lets you switch easily between several programs in one terminal, detach them and reattach them to a different terminal.

name: zellij
description: A terminal workspace with batteries included. A terminal multiplexer and more.

name: termscp
description: A terminal file transfer client and file manager with a user-friendly TUI. Supports SFTP, FTP, FTPS, SCP, and local file operations.

name: WinSCP
description: A popular free SFTP and FTP client for Windows, a powerful file manager that will improve your productivity.

name: Gickup
description: A simple, fast, and secure backup tool that uses Git as the backend. It can back up files and directories to a local or remote Git repository.

name: gitextensions
description: A graphical user interface for Git that allows you to manage your repositories, visualize your commit history, and perform common Git operations.

name: cyberduck
description: A libre server and cloud storage browser for Mac and Windows with support for FTP, SFTP, WebDAV, S3, Azure & OpenStack Swift.

name: Rio Term
description: A modern SSH client and terminal emulator that simplifies remote server management with an intuitive interface and powerful features.

name: Ghostty
description: A web-based terminal emulator that allows you to access your terminal from any device with a web browser.

name: sourcegit
description: A Git extension that allows you to manage your Git repositories with a simple and intuitive interface.

name: osv-scanner
description: A tool that scans your project dependencies for known vulnerabilities using the OSV database.

name: Helix
description: A post-modern text editor, built on a solid and efficient core, with a strong focus on performance and ergonomics.

name: Neovide
description: A simple, no-nonsense, cross-platform GUI for Neovim.

name: Meld
description: A visual diff and merge tool that helps you compare files, directories, and version controlled projects.

name: ripgrep
description: A line-oriented search tool that recursively searches your current directory for a regex pattern. Similar to grep, but faster.

name: fzf
description: A general-purpose command-line fuzzy finder. It can be used with any list; files, command history, processes, hostnames, bookmarks, git commits, etc.

name: Terraform
description: Terraform is an open-source infrastructure as code software tool created by HashiCorp. It allows users to define and provision data center infrastructure using a high-level configuration language known as HashiCorp Configuration Language (HCL), or optionally JSON.

name: OpenTofu
description: OpenTofu is a community-driven, open-source infrastructure as code (IaC) tool that enables users to define, provision, and manage cloud infrastructure using a declarative configuration language.

name: Terraformer
description: A CLI tool to generate terraform files from existing infrastructure (reverse Terraform).

name: Bitwarden
description: Bitwarden is a free and open-source password management service that stores sensitive information such as website credentials in an encrypted vault.

name: Bitwarden CLI
description: The Bitwarden CLI is a command-line interface for managing your Bitwarden vault. It allows you to perform various operations such as adding, retrieving, and deleting items in your vault.

name: Powertoys
description: A set of utilities for power users to tune and streamline their Windows experience for greater productivity.

name: ShareX
description: An open-source program that lets you capture or record any area of your screen and share it with a single press of a key. It also allows uploading images, text or other types of files to many supported destinations you can choose from.

name: BCUninstaller
description: A free and open-source program uninstaller for Windows with many features and options to make uninstalling unwanted software as easy and fast as possible.

name: WizTree
description: WizTree is a disk space analyzer tool for Windows that scans your hard drive and displays the files and folders that are taking up the most space.

name: Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager
description: Remote Desktop Manager (RDM) centralizes all your remote connections, passwords and credentials into a unique platform that can be securely shared between users and across the entire team.

name: Ventoy
description: Ventoy is an open source tool to create bootable USB drive for ISO/WIM/IMG/VHD(x)/EFI files. With Ventoy, you don't need to format the disk over and over, you just need to copy the image files to the USB drive and boot them directly.

name: Flow Launcher
description: An open source, Windows application launcher that helps you access programs and files quickly. It supports plugins to extend its functionality.

name: Playnite
description: An open source video game library manager with support for 3rd party libraries like Steam, GOG, Origin, Uplay, Epic and more.

name: Clonezilla
description: A partition and disk imaging/cloning program similar to True Image or Norton Ghost. It helps you to do system deployment, bare metal backup and recovery.

name: GParted
description: A free partition editor for graphically managing your disk partitions. With GParted you can resize, copy, and move partitions without data loss, enabling you to grow or shrink your C: drive, create space for new operating systems, and attempt data rescue from lost partitions.
